dt: {bc}marked by {d_link|greed|greed} {bc}having or showing a selfish desire for wealth and possessions
{bc}having a strong desire for food or drink

pt: {sc}covetous{/sc} {sc}greedy{/sc} {sc}acquisitive{/sc} {sc}grasping{/sc} {sc}avaricious{/sc} mean having or showing a strong desire for especially material possessions. {sc}covetous{/sc} implies inordinate desire often for another's possessions.
{sc}greedy{/sc} stresses lack of restraint and often of discrimination in desire.
{sc}acquisitive{/sc} implies both eagerness to possess and ability to acquire and keep.
{sc}grasping{/sc} adds to {sc}covetous{/sc} and {sc}greedy{/sc} an implication of selfishness and often suggests unfair or ruthless means.

pt.t: a hard {it}grasping{/it} businesswoman who cheated her associates

pt: {sc}avaricious{/sc} implies obsessive acquisitiveness especially of money and strongly suggests stinginess.

et: Middle English {it}gredy{/it}, from Old English {it}grǣdig{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}grātac{/it} greedy
shortdef: marked by greed : having or showing a selfish desire for wealth and possessions
having a strong desire for food or drink
